intro: Pseudolabatia, commonly known as the false labatia, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants are characterized by their showy, often pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. They typically have palmate leaves and produce capsules as fruit. Pseudolabatia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant floral displays.
